thread.title_full: Three charged for machete attack at grave digging in St Ann | News | Jamaica Gleaner

title: Three charged for machete attack at grave digging in St Ann | News | Jamaica Gleaner
text: Three charged for machete attack at grave digging in St Ann Three 18-year-olds were on Wednesday charged for a machete attack on a man at a grave digging in Riverhead district, St Ann. Dwight Mullings, Damion Morris, and Jamie Miller, all of Moneague in the parish, are charged with wounding with intent. A court date has yet to be finalised. The incident happened on the afternoon of Thursday, January 18. The police report that about 5:30 p.m., a man was at a grave digging when he was attacked by the accused t with machetes. The man received chop wounds to the head that resulted in serious injuries. He was transported to hospital, where he was admitted in serious condition. A report was made to the police and the men were subsequently charged. Follow The Gleaner on X, formerly Twitter, and Instagram @JamaicaGleaner and on Facebook @GleanerJamaica.
